page.title: 01Cir Mhor & Arran Ridges
page.content: Glen Sannox runs through this area a very spectacular glaciated valley. It is a characteristic "U" shape with a flat floor and steep sides. At the head of the glen is Cir Mhor a steep and rocky mountain popular with both walkers and climbers. The hills of Suidhe Fhearfhas and the castlen are on the western side of the valley. These two hills are separated by the Witches step a deep "V" shaped valley incision in the ridge where a softer rock has been eroded faster than the granite. The A Cir ridge is part of this area, and it is one of the three most dangerous in Scotland, due to it being very rocky and exposed. Nobody lives here because of the boggy and mountainous terrain. The whole area is both a site of special scientific interest and a national scenic area. Part of the land is owneed by the NTS.
